Posted By: Belz_ (4/19/2010 3:09:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@UbdU01: I believe it should have had its ability errataed to lifelink, since the life gain triggers on any damage, not just combat damage.  
  
@Milliman: Yes, Mourning Thrull's life-stealing ability does in fact stack with lifelink, because it doesn't really have lifelink. So yeah, if you enchant it with [Lifelink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lifelink), you'd gain twice the damage dealt as life. However be careful - Mourning Thrull's life-stealing ability is a triggered ability, which means that it goes on the stack, as opposed to the static lifelink ability. This means two things: First off, your opponent can counter it with effects such as [Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle), and secondly, as opposed to with the lifelink ability, you won't get the life the instant the Thrull deals damage. If your Thrull is 100/1, you're at 1 life (with only the Thrull on the battlefield), and your opponents attacks you with 2 1/1 creatures, you'd die because your life goes to 0 before you gain the life from the Thrull's a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

This means two things: First off, your opponent can counter it with effects such as Stifle, and secondly, as opposed to with the lifelink ability, you won't get the life the instant the Thrull deals damage. If your Thrull is 100/1, you're at 1 life (with only the Thrull on the battlefield), and your opponents attacks you with 2 1/1 creatures, you'd die because your life goes to 0 before you gain the life from the Thrull's a... @Test-Subject\_217601:  
  
No, this is not strictly better than [Bog Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bog Imp), because Bog Imp doesn't die to [Deathmark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathmark) or [Combust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Combust) or [Ignite Disorder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ignite Disorder), or ping you with a [Rain of Gore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rain of Gore) in play.

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (9/10/2012 8:50:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Solid 1/1 flier for ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) decks! Lifelink (and maybe [Edge of the Divinity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Edge of the Divinity)) go a long way. Also consider [Vault Skirge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault Skirge), which can cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) and 2 life for roughly the same thing, but which is unstackable with lifelink and which doesn't reap the benefits of the aforementioned aura.
posts.html:
Solid 1/1 flier for decks! Lifelink (and maybe Edge of the Divinity) go a long way. Also consider Vault Skirge, which can cost and 2 life for roughly the same thing, but which is unstackable with lifelink and which doesn't reap the benefits of the aforementioned aura.

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (5/6/2012 3:42:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The only fact that make this card not strictly better than [Bog Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bog Imp) is that this is also white. However, overall so much more preferible than the Imp, because of proto-lifelink! Even without pumping it with [Edge of the Divinity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Edge of the Divinity) this can drain quite a few life, letting you get a much better position. I like it very much! I used to dislike ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) before Ravnica, but now it's maybe my second color pair, right after ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)...  
  
4.5/5

Posted By: DacenOctavio (8/18/2011 10:55:14 AM)

posts.post_content: No, this should NOT be errata'd to say lifelink. Lifelink does not stack with itself; this ability not only stacks with itself, but with lifelink as well, as many times as you can give it.
posts.html:
No, this should NOT be errata'd to say lifelink. Lifelink does not stack with itself; this ability not only stacks with itself, but with lifelink as well, as many times as you can give it.
